rationale: Heteropneustes fossilis has a very wide range (Pakistan, India, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Thailand and Laos) and has been introduced elsewhere. Whilst it is heavily utilised for food and for medicine in many parts of its range, and it may be threatened by over exploitation and habitat loss and degradation (especially from pollution and dams), it is considered Least Concern at present.
evaluator: Vishwanath, W., Dahanukar, N. & Molur, S.
